tests.name: FindFile
tests.run: if find . -type f -name "Test*.java" -exec false {} +;  then      echo 'Test file not found'   exit 1 fi   #if [ -f "$FILE" ]; then #    echo "$FILE exists." #fi  # for every Test*.java for testfile in `find . -name "Test*.java"`; do    # get directory name   dirfile=`dirname $testfile`   # name of the class file to look for (example: Circle.java for TestCircle.java)   classfile=`echo $testfile| sed -n -e 's/^.*Test//p'`   # check if the file exists (in the same directory)   # find . -wholename $dirfile/$classfile | grep $classfile   if find . -type f -wholename $dirfile/$classfile  -exec false {} +;    then        echo 'Class file not found'     exit 1   fi  done
